title: Kettle Corn Recipe
full_text:
Kettle Corn Recipe
Close
Jump to recipe
Cook
5 mins
Cooling Time
5 mins
Total
10 mins
Serves
8
Cook Mode
(Keep screen awake)
Ingredients
1/4
cup
(60ml) neutral oil such as vegetable or canola
oil
1/2
cup
mushroom popcorn
kernels
(4 ounces; 113g) , divided (see note)
3
tablespoons
granulated sugar
3/4
teaspoon
Diamond Crystal
kosher salt; for table salt use half as much by volume
Directions
Line a large rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper; set aside. Add oil and 2 individual corn kernels to a wide 6-quart heavy-bottomed pot of Dutch oven, cover with a lid, preferably clear. Heat over medium-high heat, without moving or lifting lid, until both kernels pop and oil is hot (around 390°F), 3 to 4 minutes.
Serious Eats / Morgan Hunt Glaze
Add remaining corn kernels to pot, and gently stir to coat all kernels; sprinkle sugar and salt over kernels and gently stir to evenly coat. Cover with a lid, keeping lid slightly ajar by about 1/2 inch. Swirl the pot to move kernels around, lifting and swirling pot every 2 to 3 seconds until sugar is melted and kernels start to pop, 4 to 5 minutes. Once kernels begin to pop frequently, continue shaking pot, holding lid on tightly (but still slightly ajar), every 4 to 5 seconds, until popping slows down to 2- to 3-second intervals, 2 to 3 minutes total time.
Serious Eats / Morgan Hunt Glaze
Remove pot from heat; vigorously shake pot, holding lid on tightly. Let stand for a few seconds until popping stops. Pour popcorn onto the prepared baking sheet. Let cool for 5 minutes before transferring to a bowl and serving.
Serious Eats / Morgan Hunt Glaze
Special Equipment
Large rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper, 6-quart heavy bottomed pot or Dutch oven
Notes
Mushroom popcorn has a round and compact shape that closely resembles a mushroom cap. If unavailable, this recipe will still work with any variety of popcorn kernels, though you might need to adjust the cook time slightly.
Make-Ahead and Storage
The prepared kettle corn can be stored in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 2 days.
